theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, mitochondrial damage, and the vicious cycle of oxidative stress and energetic decline.
Emphasizes mtDNA mutations caused by mitochondrial ROS and the resulting feedback loop increasing ROS and damage.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, membrane composition (cardiolipin), and evolutionary adaptations reducing ROS.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, antioxidant defense via mitochondrial NADPH and IDH2 enzyme, and oxidative damage accumulation.
Describes mitochondrial ROS as primary source of oxidative damage, decline in antioxidant defenses, and ROS-induced cellular senescence.
Focuses on chronic oxidative stress from mitochondrial ROS, its role in aging and healthspan, and antioxidant interventions.
Describes ROS accumulation from mitochondrial metabolism, imbalance of prooxidants/antioxidants, and lifestyle influences on oxidative stress.
Links mitochondrial ROS production, membrane susceptibility, and antioxidant defenses to longevity differences across species.
Classic oxidative stress theory focusing on ROS damage accumulation, antioxidant defenses, and age-related increase in oxidative stress.
Free radical theory emphasizing mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage to biomolecules, and declining antioxidant defenses.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, antioxidant defenses, and correlation with lifespan.
Discusses oxidative damage accumulation from mitochondrial ROS, antioxidant imbalance, and genetic manipulation effects on lifespan.
Posits ROS as causal agents of aging linked to life history evolution and metabolic trade-offs, focusing on mitochondrial ROS.
Explores ROS production increase due to reproduction, antioxidant defenses, and oxidative damage affecting aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, antioxidant defense, and ROS damage accumulation as central to aging.
Describes mitochondrial dysfunction increasing ROS, balance of oxidants/antioxidants, and ROS signaling roles in aging.
Summarizes oxidative damage accumulation from mitochondrial ROS and declining antioxidant defenses driving aging.
Links mitochondrial ROS production rates inversely with longevity and oxidative damage as fundamental aging mechanism.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing mtDNA damage, mitochondrial dysfunction, altered redox state, and cellular defects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical and Nitrosative Stress Theory with Melatonin
theory_assignments.reasoning: Extends free radical theory to include reactive nitrogen species and highlights melatonin as an endogenous antioxidant mitigating oxidative/nitrosative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitohormesis and Adaptive Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mild mitochondrial stress inducing adaptive responses (mitohormesis) that enhance antioxidant defenses and promote longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS Homeostasis and Fluctuation Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes that stability and homeostatic control of ROS levels, rather than absolute ROS minimization, determine aging and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Regulated Gene Expression and Developmental Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Suggests oxidative stress regulates gene expression changes during differentiation and aging, linking metabolism, oxidative stress, and genetic programs.
Classic free radical theory emphasizing ROS damage accumulation and antioxidant enzyme activity correlating with lifespan.
Links basal metabolic rate to mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage accumulation driving metabolic aging.
